intro: Dalechampia armbrusteri, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shady environments.
